greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 1/13.
comment: In 1741, Euler recognized that 10 times this number is close to (2^i + 2^(-i))/2, see Nahin (1988) and A219705. - _Alonso del Arte_, Nov 25 2012
Also decimal expansion of sum(i=1..infinity, 1/14^i). [_Bruno Berselli_, Jan 03 2014]
reference: Paul J. Nahin, An Imaginary Tale: The Story of sqrt(-1). Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press (1988): 143.
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,-1,1).
mathematica: LinearRecurrence[{1, 0, -1, 1}, {0, 7, 6, 9}, 98] (* with C. Barker's formula, _Peter Luschny_, Aug 15 2012 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
